intro: Adenocalymma reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has a shrub-like growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are ovate to elliptical in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions and sandy soils. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and birds, contributing to its ecological importance.
